One of her greatest challenges is to be able to work and go to school at the same time but she relates that there can be no excuses or reasons to stop striving toward our goals.  Nayda used the loan to pay for her courses paying them off in order not to worry about having to pay them at the end of each month.  She is grateful to Kiva lenders for the great opportunity she’s getting to be able to reach her goals.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Las Flores Y Las Guindas - Chupaca Group

texts.es:
Reciban todos un saludo fraternal de todos los peruano!!!!, hoy les presento al grupo LAS FLORES Y LAS GUINDAS, un grupo formado por 8 socios, de las cuales la socia más entusiasta, responsable y la mas puntual del grupo es la Sra. Ivana de 42 años de edad que se dedica a la ferretería (venta de materiales de construcción, agregados, piedras)ella empieza con este negocio por que el dinero que recibía su esposo de algunos trabajos eventuales no le alcanzaba para poder mantener a sus hijos que están edad escolar, ella veía que por donde ella vivía no habían ferreterías , es por eso que ella junto un poco de capital y emprendió este negocio, ahora que le esta yendo muy bien desea incrementar la venta de yeso, ya que por la zona donde viven acostumbran usar ese material en las construcciones de las viviendas. justamente el préstamo lo utilizará en la compra de yeso.
En el futuro ella espera contar con una local mejor implementado y poder exhibir mejor la mercadería que ella vende, y así apoyar en la educación de sus hijos que en el futuro sueña ella sean unos buenos profesionales.
Ella esta muy agradecida por el apoyo de la realización de sus sueños con KIVA y EDAPROSPO.Ella esta con una casaquilla de color azul y polo azul, igual se puede ver que Nancy está con su pequeña hija.* En la parte superior de  la  izquierda  podemos verlos a Juvencio y Edelmira.
texts.en:
Receive a brotherly greeting from all Peruvians!!!  Today, I’d like to present to you the “Las Flores y las Guindas” group composed of 8 members of which the most enthusiastic, responsible and punctual member is Ivana, 42.  She sells hardware (building supplies, stone and rock).  She started the business because the money she got from her husband’s occasional jobs was insufficient to support her children who are school age.  She noticed that there were no hardware stores in the area where she lives so she gathered a bit of capital and started this business.  Now, she’s doing very well and wants to increase the sale of plaster because in the area where she lives this is a common building material for housing.

In the future, she hopes to have a better-stocked locale and to better display the merchandise she sells thus supporting her children’s education who she hopes in the future will become good professionals.

She is very grateful for the support Kiva and Edaprospo give her in the pursuit of her dreams.  She is wearing a blue jacket and blue shirt.  One can also notice that Nancy has her little girl with her. In the upper left hand corner of the photo is Juvencio and Edelmira.

loans.use: to buy plaster.

loans.name: Las Innovadoras Group

texts.es:
Hola, Buenos días! saludos de todos los peruanos. Hoy les presento al grupo de “Las Innovadoras”
Un grupo nuevo, que recién está comenzando su primer ciclo, pero ya se conocen por que trabajan en la misma localidad, todos son trabajadores independientes, que tiene el sueño de mejorara sus ingresos, y así mejorar también su forma de vida en sus hogares.
Uno de los socios de este grupo es Efraín, de 25  años de edad, que hace 3 años se dedica hacer el  servicio de taxi, ocupación y  que heredo de su padre, que también le dejó el vehículo con el que ahora trabaja.
Efraín, con los ingresos que obtiene ayuda económicamente a sus padres y sus hermanos, que están cursando estudios superiores.
Efraín sueña con ser profesional, para eso se está preparando en una academia en sus horas libres, y también ahorra un poco de sus ingresos.
El préstamo que solicita Efraín es para darle mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que con el pasar del tiempo, su carrito va sufriendo algunos desperfectos. Efraín es el segundo de la derecha viste con una chompa crema con cierre. El se encuentra agradecido por la confianza que le otroga KIVA y EDAPROSPO.
*En la parte superior media está Lisbeth con un polo verde,y en la parte superior derecha está flor con una casaca roja y chompa  marrón.
texts.en:
Hello, good morning from the Peruvian people. Today I would like to introduce you to the “Las Inovadoras” group. They are a new group that has recently begun their first loan cycle, but they already know each other because they work in the same area. They are all independent workers who have a dream to improve their incomes and to also improve the quality of life in their homes.

One of the members of this group is Efraín, who is 25 years old. He has been working as a taxi driver for 3 years, an occupation that he learned from his father. His father also gave him the vehicle from which he now works.

Efraín uses the income he earns to help his parents and his siblings, who are studying in college.

Efraín dreams of becoming a professional. In order to do this, he is studying at an academy in his free time, and he is also saving some of his income.

The loan that Efraín is requesting is for doing maintenance on his car, because with the passage of time the car is suffering from some problems. Efraín is the second from the right, wearing a cream-colored jacket with a zipper. He is grateful for the trust that Kiva and Edaprospo are showing him.

* Above the rest of the group, there is a photo of Flor, with a brown coat and a red sweater and Lisbeth with a green shirt.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance work on his taxi

loans.name: Virgen De La Puerta Group

texts.es: En esta oportunidad le presentamos a la Alcancía Comunal “Virgen de la Puerta” grupo conformado por 08 socios responsables, que tienen como único fin seguir mejorando cada día a través de sus negocios, esta vez conocerán más sobre la socia María, tiene 55 años de edad casada con 02 hijos independientes. María se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, comenzó este negocio con la idea de mejorar su economía y así poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, pues es muy buena para los negocios muestra de ello es que ha llegado a fidelizar a sus clientes.  Actualmente nos comenta que apoya a sus nietos en su educación. Implementar su negocio es el deseo de María. Su último crédito lo destinará para  la compra de mercadería como arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos y menestras y de esta manera tener surtida su tienda. María está ubicada al lado izquierdo viste polo color rosado y chompa negra. El grupo “Virgen de la Puerta” agradecen el crédito brindado ya que hacen posible su progreso y se compromenten a seguir trabajando bien con el Programa.
texts.en:
We take this opportunity to present the communal bank group "Virgen de la Puerta" which consists of eight responsible members whose objective is to continue to be better each day.  One member, Maria, is 55 years old, married, and has two independent children.  Currently, she supports her grandchildren.  Maria business is selling products of basic necessity which she began in order to better her economic situation and to give her family a better life.  She is a very good businesswoman who has gained the loyalty of her customers.    

Maria's hope is to set up her business, and she is thinking of selling gas, minutes for cell phones, etc.  She is asking for this loan to buy merchandise to supply her store.  

In the photo above, Maria is on the left side dressed in a pink shirt and black jacket.  The group "Virgen de la Puerta" is thankful for this loan that helps make its progress possible.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk, noodles, and vegetables

loans.name: Rose Nadine

texts.fr: Rose Nadine est une jeune Camerounaise âgée de 31 ans, célibataire et mère de deux enfants âgés respectivement de 06 et 14 ans qui vont tous à l'école. elle vend du poisson braisé dans un site de la ville depuis 08 ans aujourd'hui. elle a en plus de ses enfants 02 autres personnes à sa charge et subvient à leurs besoins tant bien que mal grace aux revenus que lui génère sa petite activité. sa bonne expérience, sa bonne humeur,son accueil toujours chaleureux et sa qualité de service lui ont permis aujourd'hui d'avoir une clientèle considérable, clientèle dont elle n'arrive plus à satisfaire la demande étant donné la petitesse de son capital. elle voudrait donc avec ce crédit acheter du poisson (elle en vend 30 kg par jour, des tables et des chaises pour améliorer le cadre de réception et satisfaire sa clientèle. les revenus supplémentaires générés lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins éducatifs et nutritionnels de ses enfants. elle a pour ambition d'ouvrir un autre point de vente.
texts.en:
Rose Nadine is a young Cameroonian, 31 years old, unmarried, and the mother of two children, 6 and 14 years old, who are both in school. She has been selling roasted fish at a site in the city for eight years now. In addition to her children, she has two other persons to support, and she meets their needs as bests she can, thanks to the revenues that her small business generates, her good experience, good humor, always-warming welcome, and the quality of her service, all of which has today allowed her to have a significant customer base, which makes demands she can no longer satisfy because of her meager capital. 

She would therefore like to use this loan to buy fish (she sells 30 kg per day), tables, and chairs to improve her accommodations and to make her customers happy. The extra revenues generated will enable her to do better in meeting her children's educational and nutritional needs. Her ambition is to open another sales outlet.

loans.use: to buy fish, tables, and chairs

loans.name: Claudia

texts.fr: Claudia est une veuve âgée de 45 ans et mère de 05 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 07 et 25 ans et parmi lesquels 04 vont à l'école. Elle un restaurant depuis 04 ans aujourd'hui dans lequel en plus de la nourriture elle y vend également de la boisson. depuis le décès de son époux, elle vit et nourrit ses enfants des revenus que lui génère cette activité. elle voudrait avec ce crédit acheter du poisson, 03 casiers de boissons et des chaises de réception pour pouvoir améliorer le cadre de son activité et satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. elle a comme ambition pour sa famille d'envoyer son fils aîné dans une grande école de commerce, et pour son activité d'ouvrir un second restaurant.
texts.en:
Claudia is a widow, 45 years old, and the mother of five children, from 7 to 25 years old. Among the children, four are in school. Claudia has had a restaurant for four years now in which she sells not only food but drinks. Since her husband has died, she uses the revenues from this business to raise her children and feed them. 

With this loan, she would like to buy some fish, 3 cases of drinks, and some chairs to improve her business' accommodations and to make her customers happy. Her ambition for her family is to send her oldest son to a major business school. And for her work, it is to open a second restaurant.

loans.use: to buy fish, 2 cases of hygienic beverages, and chairs

loans.name: Makimbilio Group

texts.fr: La cliente Anneth est leader du groupe d’affaire Makimbilio. Elle est jeune entrepreneur, âgé de 22 ans et mère de 3 enfants qui n’ont pas encore commencé la scolarité. Son mari est un vendeur de souliers. La cliente est vendeuse de beignets. Elle expose ses produits devant son domicile. Elle commença cette micro entreprise avec le crédit de l’IMF Hekima. Avec ce nouveau crédit, elle va acheter 50 kg de farines, sucres, 10 litres d’huiles. Actuellement, elle vient de réaliser 2 cycles dans le programme. Elle souhaite acheter une parcelle et y construire confortablement. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
This client, Anneth, is the leader of the business group Makimbilio. She is a young entrepreneur, 22 years old, and the mother of three children, who have not yet starting school. Anneth's husband is a shoe seller. She is a beignet seller. She displays her products in front of her home. 

She started this micro-enterprise with loans from the microfinance institution Hekima. With this new loan, she is going to buy 50 kg of different flours, sugar, and 10 liters of different oils. Currently she just completed 2 cycles in the program. 

She wishes to buy a plot of land and build on it with ease. She therefore thanks Hekima for its support of small-scale entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 50 kg of different flours, sugar, and 10 liters of different oils

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Teresita works hard to support her family. She has a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. Teresita is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy more items like pants, blouses, and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more pants, blouses, and other ready-to-wear clothing items.

loans.name: Vanney

texts.en:
Vanney used to be a farmer, but she quit the farming business. She now stays at home and does housework. The main source of income is from her husband's salary. He works for the Ministry of National Defense. 

She lives in a village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and has six children: two sons and four daughters. Two of her children are midwives, two are soldiers, and two attend school. 

Vanney had asked for a Kiva loan. She is now requesting another loan in the amount of 1,200 USD to build a fence around her house.

loans.use: To build a fence around her house.

loans.name: Sopheak

texts.en:
Sopheak (in the photo), age 26, sells recycling materials. His wife Hon, age 31, is a garment worker. They have been married since 2007 and have two young children: one son and one daughter. Sopheak's mother also lives with him. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh. 

Sopheak is asking for his first Kiva loan in order to buy a motorcycle for his wife to drive to work. Currently she commutes to work on a bicycle, but taking a bicycle to work is tiring and does not always get her there on time.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for his wife to get to work.

loans.name: Horimbere Group

texts.fr:
Emmanuel fait partie du groupe Horimbere et  habite à Bujumbura. Il a 55 ans et est marié à Jeanne, commerçante des habits. Ensemble ils ont 7 enfants, âgés de  6 à 20 ans,  tous étudient.

Il fait le commerce de boutique (haricot, riz, sucre,…) depuis 20 ans. 

Il est à son neuvième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de sucre, de riz, de haricot,… à revendre dans sa boutique, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait  faire le commerce d’importation des marchandises en provenance de l’Ouganda, acheter un véhicule d’usage pour son commerce et il voudrait aussi faire l’élevage moderne.
texts.en:
Emmanuel is part of the group Horimbere and lives in Bujumbura. He is 55 years old and married to Jeanne, a clothing merchant. Together they have seven children, from 6 to 20 years old, all in school. 

He has been a shopkeeper (beans, rice, sugar…) for twenty years. 

He is on his ninth loan with Turame. With this KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and buy a large amount of sugar, rice, beans… to resell in his shop, so as to earn more. 

In the next few years, he would like to do commerce importing merchandise from Uganda, buy a vehicle for business, and also to be a modern livestock farmer.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of sugar, rice, beans... to resell in his shop

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Sophal is a garment factory worker, while her husband is a construction contractor. The couple has been married since 1992 and has three children: two sons and one daughter. All of them are in school. The family is living in a village about 20 kilometers of Phnom Penh City.

Sophal has received and repaid two previous Kiva loans. She is now requesting a loan in order to help her brother to purchase a tuk-tuk (auto-rickshaw).

loans.use: to help her brother to purchase a tuk-tuk (auto-rickshaw)

loans.name: Saroun

texts.en:
Saroun, age 40, is a tuk-tuk (auto-rickshaw) taxi driver. His wife, Sophal, age 41, is a cleaner for a hotel. They have been married since 1992 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. One is married and lives in separately, another is a garment worker, and the other two attend school. The family lives on an island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Saroun is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,500. He will use $600 to buy a new motorcycle because his current one is old and damaged. He will use the remaining $900 to finish his house construction, since he is in the process of rebuilding the family home.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle and to finish his house construction

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is a farmer in the Nkubu area of central Kenya, where she lives with her three adult children. She is widowed. She runs her farm with one farmhand and grows maize and beans. She says farming has always been her source of  income. She also runs a cereals retail business to earn additional income.

Anne has requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 KES, which she will use to buy poultry birds to start up a venture into the poultry farming business. She hopes to earn enough income to help support herself and to help her realize her dream of owning residential houses in the future.

She says managing pests and animal diseases are the major challenges in her work.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds to raise

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mon (pictured here), age 41, is single. She lives with her brother in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Mon sells fish and vegetables. She is requesting a loan of 700 USD to purchase a motorbike to transport fish and vegetables to the market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport fish and vegetables to the market

loans.name: Ivania

texts.es:
Doña Ivania  trabaja como alguacil del poder judicial de Nueva Guinea, ella recibe la ayuda econòmica para los gastos del hogar de su esposo quien trabaja como tecnico de la UNAG, Ambos son reconocidos  en el municipio por ser responsables, honestos y trabajadores , es una mujer que ha luchado por tener mejores condiones familiares, le gusta progresar  material y profesionalmente.   
Solicita su crèdito para realizarle pequeños arreglos a la cocina como embaldozado y asi poder obtener mejores condiciones de su familia.
 
Su sueño es seguir estudiando, gozar de salud y trabajo.
texts.en:
Ivania works as a bailiff for the New Guinea judiciary.  She receives financial help for the household expenses from her husband.  He works as a technician for UNAG [National Union of Farmers and Ranchers].

Both she and her husband are well-known in the municipality for being responsible, honest, and hard-working.  She is a woman who has struggled to have better living conditions for her family.  She likes to make material and professional progress.

She is requesting her loan to make small improvements, like tiling, to the kitchen.   This way she will be able to get better living conditions for her family.

Her dream is to continue studying, enjoying good health, and working.

loans.use: to improve her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a zero-grazing unit for her farm

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Savoeun (in the photo) is 38 years old and her husband, Sokhom, is 40 years old. They live in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, and they have five children: one son and four daughters.  

Savoeun is a garment worker, while her husband is a construction worker. She is asking for a loan in the amount of $500 to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to drive to work. Her husband currently rides a bicycle to work, which makes him tired and arrive late.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband to drive to work

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang, age 44 and widowed, is a weaver. She lives in a village across the Mekong River, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has two daughters. One is married and the other is a chef's assistant. 

Neang would like a proper restroom for her home, which would improve the health and living conditions of her family. She has decided to apply for a loan in the amount of $600 in order to build a restroom.

loans.use: to build a restroom for family use

loans.name: Asphod

texts.en:
Asphod is 32 years old, married, and has two children. He is a farmer and has been in this business for one year.  He earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES.

Asphod is requesting his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase seedlings and fertilizer and pay laborers on the farm. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.  He hopes to own a supermarket in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Cristiam Lilliet

texts.es:
Doña Cristiam Lilieth de 42 años de edad, labora como oficial notificador del poder Judicial desde hace 20 años, la cual ha demostrado gran, responsabilidad y honestidad, es una mujer muy sencilla y muy querida por sus compañeros de trabajos,   tiene dos hijos mayores de edad, ambos trabajan y ayudan con los gastos familiares.          
Doña Cristien a su edad por los limitantes economicos y sus gastos que a pesar de contar con un trabajo digno pero aun le falta para lograr ver terminada su vivienda ya que ella lo ha realizado con esfuerzos propios y creditos obtenidos por afodenic, por lo que despues de dos años Solicita refianciamiento   para invertirlo  en  compra de materiales de construccion y asi terminar de construir su Digno Hogar que tanto anela.  De esta manera brindarle mejor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Cristiam Lilliet, age 42, has worked as a notification official for the judiciary branch for 20 years.  This has shown her to be very responsible and honest.  She is a very unassuming woman who is very dear to her work colleagues.  She has two grown children.  They both work and help with the family expenses.

Cristiam, due to her age and financial limitations, does not have enough money, in spite of having a decent job, to finish her house.  The work on her house has been done through her own efforts and loans from Afodenic. 

After two years she is requesting refinancing in order to buy construction materials to finish building the modest home that she so longs for.  This way she will make her family more comfortable.

loans.use: to improve her house.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 42-year-old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for six years. He was initially in agriculture. His hardships include high taxes, price fluctuations and inflation. His personal goals are to educate his children and upgrade his studies while his business goals are to hire employees to help expand the business and to expand the business into new markets.
Julius is requesting a loan to buy sodas and sugar for resale.

loans.use: to buy sodas and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Wicliff

texts.en:
Wicliff is a 45-year-old married man with ten children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in commercial farming for 20 years. He started with 20 coffee trees and now has 300 coffee trees. His hardships are seasonal weather changes and inadequate capital to purchase modern farming equipment. His personal goals are to educate his children, buy a car, and build a permanent home. His business goals are to buy more land to grow crops and hire employees to help expand the business.
Wicliff intends to use his loan to pay workers who are mulching, weeding and ploughing his farmland.

loans.use: to pay workers who are mulching, weeding and ploughing his farmland.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim (shown in the photo) and her husband are rice farmers. They also raise cows at home. Sim has previously requested a Kiva loan to purchase a motorbike for her son to get to work. She is now requesting another loan to buy a motorcycle for her daughters, who are garment workers, to drive to work. 
Sim and her husband live in a village approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have four sons and three daughters – two are married, three are garment workers, one is a security guard and other attends school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her daughters to get to work.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: This time, Delia is borrowing Php 29,500 to fund her general store business. The general store and food vending business that she previously funded through NWTF and KIVA partner continues and provides her Delia and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn had a loan for 15,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy materials and supplies needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and for their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

Evelyn is requesting another loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy materials and supplies needed in her landscaping business. Her profits from her business will help her to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. Evelyn dreams of giving her children a good education through all her hard work on her business. 

Evelyn faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase materials and supplies needed for landscaping projects.

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
Noralyn works hard to support three children. She is married and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.

Noralyn requested a PHP 4600 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a good light-source that is waterproof during the rainy season.

Noralyn is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Quzi

texts.en:
Quzi is an enterprenurial man who is married and has two children. He has been busy with animal husbandry and growing wheat for more than ten years. Little by little, with the passing of the years, he has perfected his knowledge. Thanks to the good condition of his animals and the high quality of his wheat, he has managed to win a large number of customers for his business. He sells his animals and wheat in the local market. Many of his customers are local butchers and bakers who are glad to buy from him. 
Quzi is looking for a loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for the land he works. In this way he will be able to offer his customers good wheat and continue to make financial progress, providing his household with good earnings. Moreover, he will be able to offer his son access to a better quality education and a financial stability that will allow him to progress. Each month he will make his payments on time. Quzi is thankful to all lenders for their help and support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 37 years old and from Ndunyu Njeru. He is married with three children aged between one and seven.
Simon has an Agrovet business (agricultural supplies) that he has been running for the past two years. He has applied for his second loan from Kiva partner KADET to enable him to boost his business by buying assorted items such as fertilizers and seedlings for resale.
Simon hopes to be able to pay the school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more assorted items such as fertilizers, seedlings, and animal feed  for resale.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is 49 years old and married to Jane. They live in Nyahururu town and they have two children. Stanley sells milk both in retail and also supplies to various customers in the market place and his business has been very profitable.

This being his first loan amount, he plans to buy more stock of milk to sell. With the anticipated income, he plans to buy a motorcycle. With the motorcycle, he will be able to transport milk to his customers.

In the future, Stanley plans to open more milk bars in the area to make more income and be able to provide for his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy more stock of milk to sell.

loans.name: Girasoles Group

texts.es: Rosa tiene 37 años de edad, es  miembro del Grupo Solidario Girasoles, es soltera, no tiene hijos, ella reside en la comunidad del Zapotillo, Jamastran, de la ciudad de Danli. Es una persona muy luchadora y servicial. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la elaboración de prendas de vestir, haciendo diseños con sus diferentes telas y colores, haciendo sus mejores diseños y poniendo en practica sus técnicas en diferentes trabajos que realiza, Rosa aprendió la costura cuando trabajo en una maquila, aprendió muy bien y con el tiempo se propuso a iniciar con su propia microempresa de costura, el horario de trabajo lo realiza de 7:00 am y culmina a las 6:00 pm. Con la ayuda de este préstamo comprara telas de diferentes tipos y colores para realizar diferentes tipos de trabajo. Con la ayuda de este préstamo podrá tener suficiente capital para poder comprar todos los accesorios que necesita para confeccionar sus prendas. Es el segundo préstamo que solicita Rosa en FAMA y ha cancelado sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Rosa, 37, is a member of Girasoles Solidarity Group.  She's single with no children and lives in the community of Zapotillo, Jamastran, in the city of Danli.  She's a fighter and a very obliging person.

For 20 years she has worked making clothing, designing with various fabrics and colors, making her best styles, and practicing her techniques on a variety of garments that she makes.  Rosa learned sewing when she worked in a "maquila" [foreign-owned factory].  She learned very well and in time decided to open her own small tailor shop.  She works from 7:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.

With the help of this loan she's going to buy different types and colors of fabric to make different types of garment.  With the help of this loan she'll be able to have enough capital to be able to buy all the accessories she needs to make her garments.

This is the second loan Rosa has requested from FAMA and she has made her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a 46-year-old resident of Sto. Niño, Tukuran. Ruth has provided her three children's needs from the little amount of 14,000 she has earned monthly from her Tupperware items business for 4 years as an aid to the income earned by her husband. However, in 2010 she became a member of GDMPC, and she is applying for a loan at GDMPC micro finance of 50,000 PHP to buy more Tupperware items to sell. Ruth wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy more Tupperware items to sell

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en: Rodrigo, 44 years old, is a married entrepreneur of Sto. Niño, Tukuran with three children and is earning from his transport service business. It started almost 2 years ago and he earns 4,000 a month. To improve business, he is borrowing the amount of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit which he just joined recently to obtain accessories and tires. Before long, Rodrigo is hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is from Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 41 years old. Adelina is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Adelina is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home use products in the local community. Adelina has been in her business for 8 years and earns 4,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

Adelina is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. In 2011, Adelina joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Koemsrun

texts.en:
Koemsrun (in the photo) is 34 years old and her husband, Chamreun is 39 years old. They live in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1997 and have two daughters--one attends school and another one is still young.  

Koemsrun is a farmer; she grows different kinds of crops such as sesame, corn and rice. Her husband is a goldsmith.

Koemsrun wants to build a kitchen where she can cook because she does not have a proper kitchen. That’s why she decided to request her first Kiva loan in order to make the constructions.

loans.use: To build a kitchen where she can cook.

loans.name: Cristeta

texts.en:
This is Cristeta. She previously accessed a 32,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase enough LPG (liquefied petroleum gas), plastic and other essential materials to cook and package her products. Her earnings were a big help towards the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

Criseta would like to apply for another 41,000 PHP loan to buy additional ingredients (plastic, LPG and other materials) needed in her business. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and to pay for the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Cristeta dreams to expand her business and help her children through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients and materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.en:
A beautiful woman by the name of Mutabar lives in a house that is in a bad condition. Her husband Usmon is a kind man who works in the local school as a teacher and has a very small salary. They have two clever children aged 26 and 28. Mutabar’s children want to live in a house that is in good condition but her income from animal husbandry is insufficient to pay for repairs. She needs to repair the roof of her house initially and then she needs to change the doors and windows. When it rains the roof of her house cannot withstand it. Mutabar and her family are afraid of the cold and the wind. She is asking for a loan of 9000 TJS to repair her house. 
In this way Mutabar will be able to offer her family a better quality of life and moral stability that will allow them to progress. Each month she will make her payment on time. She awaits your support and mercy. Please help her and her family if possible.

loans.use: to buy cement, doors, windows and wood to repair her house.

loans.name: Tamba Group

texts.en:
Mwanaidi, age 38, is married and has six children (3 boys and 3 girls); three of them go to school. She has had a fruit and vegetable business since 2010. She works from 8am to 6pm daily and she is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to add more tomatoes, onions, vegetables, carrots, fruits and has paid back the loan successfully. She wants a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables. Her dream is to one day be able to buy her own plot of land.

The borrower will share this loan with her loan group "Tamba"  which totals 17 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis  is 53 years old. He is married to Grace and together they have two children. He operates a posho mill whereby he grinds maize meal  and sells it to his customers and has been in the business for the past three years.

This is his first loan in KADET LTD. He was introduced by a field officer. He will use the loan amount to purchase stock of dry maize for use in his business.

He hopes to own modern machines in his business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of dry maize for use in his business.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en: Augustine is a thirty-seven-year-old married man with six children living in Kasese, Uganda.His hardships are seasonal weather changes and inadequate capital to purchase stock. Personal goals are educating his children, buying a car and building a permanent home while his business goals are buying land to grow crops and hiring employees to help expand his farming activities. Augustine intends to use the loan to pay workers who are ploughing his land.

loans.use: to pay workers who are ploughing his land.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: JUANA ES UNA MUJER LUCHADORA DIGNA DE ADMIRACIÓN  QUE TIENE 42 AÑOS NACIÓ EN COCHABAMBA VIVE EN LA ZONA SANTA BÁRBARA  EN UNO DE LOS BARRIOS MAS POBRES,  TIENE 4 HIJOS. DOÑA JUANA  DA TODO POR SUS HIJOS,  YA QUE EL PADRE DE LOS NIÑOS MURIÓ EN UN ACCIDENTE DE TRABAJO,  HACE 2 AÑOS. MOTIVO POR EL CUAL AGARRA UNA PENSIÓN PERO NO LO ES SUFICIENTE PARA MANTENER A SUS HIJOS. TIENE SU TIENDA DE BARRIO POR SU ZONA DONDE VENDE UNA VARIEDAD DE PRODUCTOS COMO REFRESCOS, PAN Y OTROS, TAMBIÉN VENDE COMIDA PARA PENSIONADOS EN SU TIENDA V. LA CLIENTE  NECESITA MAS CAPITAL DE TRABAJO YA QUE QUIERE TENER UNA VARIEDAD DE PRODUCTOS EN SU TIENDA.  EL PRESENTE CRÉDITO PARA ELLA ES UNA OPORTUNIDAD PARA FORTALECER SU EMPRENDIMIENTO EN EL CUAL YA TIENE UNA ANTIGÜEDAD DE 2 AÑOS.
texts.en:
Juana is a tenacious woman who is worthy of admiration.  She’s 42-years-old and was born in Cochabamba.  She lives in the Santa Bárbara zone, one of the poorest neighborhoods.  She has four children.

Juana gives everything for her children since their father was killed in a work-related accident two years ago.  She receives a pension because of this but it’s not sufficient to support her children.  

She has a neighborhood store in her zone where she sells a variety of products like soft-drinks, bread and others.  She also sells meals for retired people in her store.  She needs more working capital because she wants to have a good variety of merchandise in stock.  The current loan is an opportunity for her to strengthen her enterprise which to date has been in operation two years.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo is a small entrepreneur who lives at Annafatan with his wife and a child, who attends school. Domingo manages a store selling grocery items to the people in his village, while his wife is a public elementary school teacher. They love their work as their livelihood. Aside from managing his small business, Domingo also cooks and sells food for daily meals and adds up his daily income. He is now asking for PHP50,000 to buy soft drinks, eggs, breads, soap and shampoo to sell in his store. With the additional merchandise to sell, he will increase his income. 

Domingo hopes to keep extending good service to his customers and have more friends. Likewise, he will gain more income too. He hopes to become successful in his business for the overall welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, eggs, breads, soap and shampoo to sell in her store.

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en:
Bibiana is a rice grower and has kept improving their farming business for almost 20 years now. With her spouse, she plants and harvests rice to sell to traders. She has four children. Two of her children have already finished a degree, through the parents' efforts in generating income from the rice field to be able to pay for matriculation fees. 

Bibiana is now asking for a loan of PHP50,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. She hopes to improve her crop production and gain more profits because the rest of her children are still attending to school. All she wants is to give the best education to her children. 

With healthy, good crops to grow, she will achieve abundant harvests and fully attain success in the farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming.

loans.name: Sharav

texts.en:
Twenty-six-year-old Mr. Sharav, who became a driver in 2005, has been running a taxi service since 2012. He previously worked as a carrier in a supermarket. Sharav lives with his wife, son and parents-in-law in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His family owns a small land plot and lives in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic yurt.

Because it is very dangerous and uncomfortable to live in a ger district in Mongolia, Sharav is requesting a loan to buy building materials including iron pipes and timbers to build a wooden fence. He calculates it will cost about $2,000.000, so his brother will provide additional support for this project.

loans.use: to build a fence.

loans.name: Friday

texts.en: Friday is a thirty-three-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for three years. He got capital from his previous employment as a shop attendant. His hardship is customers not paying on time. His personal goal is building a permanent house and his business goal is moving his business to more permanent location. Friday wants money to buy deep freezer so as to preserve perishable goods such as yoghurt, tomatoes and cow ghee.

loans.use: to buy a deep freezer so as to preserve perishable goods.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma works hard to support her family. Norma is married and has a fishing and fish vending business in the Philippines.

Norma requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for her fishing business. Norma has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Norma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Rosa Virginia

texts.es:
El señora Rosa es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien se dedica desde hace 30 años a la elaboración de gelatinas, agua, jugos y helados. Este negocio lo inicio con la venta de sorbetes y gelatinas y poco a poco fue aumentándolo.
El crédito lo invertirá en materia prima principalmente plástico para empacar el producto que es más caro.
texts.en: Rosa is a very hardworking, enterprising woman who has been working the last 30 years making gelatin treats, water, juice and ice-cream.  She started the business selling sorbets and gelatin and gradually added to it.  She will use the loan to buy raw materials manly packing plastic for her products which is very expensive.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.en:
Muhayo is a 47-year-old woman. She is a divorcee and the mother of 2 children, aged 24 and 26 years old. She has been busy with animal husbandry for three years. Thanks to her good experience in this field and her influence over her suppliers, she is able to obtain animals to sell but it brings in little income. It does not allow her to provide for the needs of her family and build new house because her family needs to bigger house. This year she is going to build a new house with modern planning. Her son Dilshod wants to married in a lovely girl this year and they will live in the new house.

This loan will help her buy building materials to build her new house. In this way she will provide high quality of living conditions for her family and put an end to their problems with the house.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement and wood for building a new house

loans.name: Bayarmagnai

texts.en:
Mrs. Bayarmagnai, 42, sells groceries in her rented grocery store. She rents it at MNT 250,000 a month. Her daily earnings are not so good, however she puts aside saving for her son’s education or school fees. 

Bayarmagnai is a widow and now she lives with her son in the 'ger' district, an area with Mongolian traditional nomadic yurts in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She is requesting a loan to buy groceries from her supplier to increase the stock and for larger sales volume. It is a very important thing to increase her business earnings. 

Also she will use her loan to repair her fence which was broken by a storm. The loan she is taking will be dedicated to increasing the stock of her grocery store and repairing the fence.

loans.use: To increase the stock of her grocery store and repair her broken fence.

loans.name: Almer Tito

texts.es: El cliente el señor Tito tiene 29 años de edad, no  tiene hijos, estudio la secundaria en Cochabamba en uno de los colegios mas humildes, siendo siempre uno de los mejores estudiantes, perseverante con sus metas. Estudio en la Universidad Mayor de San Simón la carrera de Técnico Superior en Marketing, al mismo tiempo de cursar su escuela, colegio y estudios superiores trabajaba de asistente  junto a su padre, abuelo y hermanos en la manufactura de botas, aprendió rápido el negocio familiar a los 10 años ya realizaba botas el solo. El cliente el señor Tito es una persona emprendedora que quiere ver crecer el negocio familiar junto a sus conocimientos ejercidos en mercadotecnia, ahora necesita dinero para poder  comprar materia prima,  como ser los cueros, plantas para las botas, y otros que entran en la elaboración de las botas. Es por este  motivo ya mencionado que es  el presente crédito.
texts.en:
Tito, 29, has no children.  He studied secondary school in Cochabamba in one of the humblest schools; he was always one of the best students always focused on his goals.  He attended the Universidad Mayor de San Simón in the Superior Marketing Technician career.  At the same time he was attending school, secondary school and university, he worked as an assistant for his father, grandfather and brothers manufacturing boots.  He learned the family business quickly and at the age of 10 was already making boots by himself.

Tito is an enterprising person who wants to see the family business grow enhanced with his marketing skills.  He needs money now to buy raw materials like leather, soles for the boots and others that are needed for boot production.  The current loan request is for this purpose.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Jaime Daniel

texts.es: El señor Jaime tiene 38 años tiene 2 hijos, emigro del occidente de Bolivia, junto a sus padres en busca de mejor calidad de vida, estudio la secundaria en Cochabamba en uno de los colegios mas humildes, siendo siempre uno de los mejores estudiantes, perseverante con sus metas estudio en la Universidad Mayor de San Simón la carrera de Ciencias Jurídicas, al mismo tiempo de cursar su pregrado trabajaba de asistente en un consultorio jurídico en el cual gano experiencia, se graduó de la carrera de Ciencias Jurídicas y abrió su propio consultorio junto a un compañero de la universidad, al principio solo tenían un escritorio y una computadora, paso el tiempo con su esmero y dedicación abrió su consultorio independientemente, ahora necesita dinero para poder renovar sus muebles como ser su escritorio, estantes y computadora motivo por el cual es el presente crédito.
texts.en:
Jaime is 36, and has two children. He emigrated from western Bolivia with his parents, in search of a better quality of life. He went to high school in Cochabamba in one of the most humble schools. 

Always being one of the best students, and persevering in working toward his goals, he studied at the University Mayor de San Simón for a degree in Law. At the same time as he studied his undergraduate program, he worked as an assistant in a law office, where he gained experience. 

He graduated with a law degree, and together with a fellow graduate from the university, opened his own office. In the beginning they only had one desk and one computer. After a time, through his effort and dedication, he opened an office independently. 

Now he needs money to be able to update his furniture, including his desk, shelves and computer. This is the reason for the present loan.

loans.use: To buy furniture, in order to improve his law office.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 53 years old and married, with 3 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Veronica has a dried-fish business in the Philippines. She has requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Veronica has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine, a 26-year-old single mother of three children living in Kasese, Uganda, has been selling secondhand clothes and party decorations for five years. Her hardships are high fuel and transportation costs, and her personal goals are educating her children and expanding the business into new markets. Christine is requesting this loan to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jenelie

texts.en:
Jenelie is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a retail generic medicine business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years. She earns additional income by selling charcoal and fruit at retail.

She is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell. 

Jenelie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 44-year-old married man with six children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. He has been farming bananas and coffee for five years. Richard is requesting money to buy fertilizers and pay workers.

His challenges are price fluctuations and inflation. His personal goal is educating his children, while his business goal is diversifying his business to include motorcycle transport.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay workers

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: La Sra. Graciela de 41 años de edad tiene dos hijos los cuales aun dependen de ella económicamente. Ella se separo de su esposo y ha sacado a sus hijos adelante por su propia fuerza, es digna de la admiración de muchos inclusive de sus propios hijos, para ellos es un ejemplo de superación y esfuerzo. Ella sabe que tiene que darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, es por eso que pide de nuestra ayuda para reparar el techo de su casa. Ella agradecería la ayuda que se pueda brindar.
texts.en:
Graciela is 41, and has two children who still depend on her financially. She is separated from her husband, and has raised her children through her own efforts. She is worthy of the admiration of many, including that of her own children. For them, she is an example of overcoming and effort. 

She knows that she has to give her children a better quality of life. That is why she is requesting help to repair the roof of her home. She would be grateful for the help that may be provided.

loans.use: To rebuild the roof of her house.

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es: Martha Isabel esta solicitando el 1er crédito para comprar  mercancía ya que actualmente se dedica a vender ropa, calzado y artículos usados ella quiere invertir para comprar ropa nueva, al entrevistarla y conocer su proyecto nos dimos cuenta que es una joven emprendedora ya no estudia porque se quiere dedicar al comercio su mama  dice que es una joven muy madura y que desea crecimiento comercial ella la apoya  en este reto e informo que de lunes a miércoles elabora tortillas de harina y las vende con sus vecinos, Martha Isabel es soltera.
texts.en:
Martha Isabel is requesting her first loan to buy merchandise.  Currently she works selling clothing, footwear, and used items.  She wants to invest in buying new clothing.

Upon interviewing her and learning about her project we realized that she's a young entrepreneur.  She's not a student anymore because she wants to work in business.

Her mother says she's a very mature young woman who wants business growth.  She supports her in this challenge and said that from Monday through Wednesday she makes flour tortillas and sells them to her neighbors.  Martha Isabel is single.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Mauricio Michael

texts.es:
MAURICIO MICHAEL tiene 21 años, Es soltero vive con los padres, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUCHANDO POR UNA MISMA CAUSA, se encuentra ubicada en el en el Recinto La primavera, perteneciente al Canton Ventans, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

MAURICIO MICHAEL se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar semilla, insecticidas, urea. Las compras las hará en Ventanas.

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafios como las plagas que dañan los cultivos. El sueño es seguir trabajando para progresar junto a los padres. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbool.
texts.en:
Mauricio Michael, 21, is single living with his parents in Ventanas Canton in Los Ríos Province.  The members of the “Luchando por Una Misma Causa” (Striving for the Same Cause) communal bank are located in Recinto La Primavera belonging to Ventanas Canton.  This communal bank is involved in chores related to short cycle corn and rice farming.

Mauricio Michael farms corn.  He’s asking for the loan to buy seeds, insecticide and urea.  He’ll make his purchases in Ventanas.

With support from the loan he’ll be able to have economic support to fill his needs.  He faces the challenge of infestations that damage his crops.  His dream is to continue working towards progress alongside his parents.  In his free time he enjoys playing soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn would like to apply for another loan.  She previously borrowed 9,000 PHP to purchase additional grocery items, as well as a wider variety of grocery items, needed in her business. With her earnings, Marilyn has been able to significantly assist in the payment of her children’s education expenses as well as her family’s personal, household and business expenses. 

With a new loan of 13,000 PHP loan, Marilyn would like to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. Marilyn believes the more items displayed at the store, the better, and the greater her returns will be.  The profit from her business will definitely help her provide for her daily needs as well as the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to increased income with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Marilyn hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to provide her family with a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work; at these meetings, she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
This is Jesusa, She previously accessed a 19,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more stock of a variety of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and with her family's personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. The profits from her business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs and the educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Jesusa hopes her business will grow in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Yokonia

texts.en: Yokonia is a forty-year-old married man with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for five years. He started with 500,000 shillings and now has 2,500,000 shillings worth of stock. His hardships are inadequate capital to purchase enough inventory to meet the high demand, price fluctuations and inflation. His personal goals are educating his children and buying a car while his business goals are moving his business to more permanent location and expanding the business into new markets. Yokonia wants money to buy shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of rice grains to sell for her rice grains business. Rosemarie has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from farming sugarcane.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 26 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Thelma has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 9 years and also earns an income from selling candy, raising pigs and rice retailing.

Thelma aspires to save money to expand her businesses.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim is 62 years of age and married with five children who are already married and have independent lives. Sim is in the business of cultivating rice and raising pigs for both slaughter and offspring. Upon maturity, Sim can sell her pigs to local middlemen or butchers for a profit. The hog-raising business becomes the second major source of her income. Sim has been in these two businesses for over 30 years.

Sim would like to have financial assistance through HKL for the improvement of her current businesses, which is why she is asking for a loan in the amount of KHR 2,000,000 to purchase feeds for her pigs and to pay the labor costs in transplanting her rice crops. Through this loan, Sim hopes that she could have her pigs grow quickly and make her businesses more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for her pigs and to pay the labor costs for transplanting her rice crops.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro pertenece al Banco Comunal Kausachun, tiene 52 años de edad, es soltero y padre de 4 hijos (1 varón y tres mujeres). Es socio de FINCA Perú hace 2 años. Él es mecánico y trabaja con todo tipo de automóviles. En este tiempo como socio de FINCA Perú, Alejandro ha aprendido a ahorrar, a ser responsable y puntual. Su sueño para el futuro es comprar un terreno donde pueda construir una casa y vivir con sus hijos. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en una la compra de una maquina soldadora para su negocio.
texts.en: Alejandro belongs to the "Kausachun" communal bank.  He’s 52-years-old, single and the father of four children, one boy and three girls.  He’s been a member of FINCA Perú for two years.  He’s a mechanic and works on all types of automobiles.  In his time in FINCA Perú, Alejandro has learned how to save and to be responsible and punctual.  His dream for the future is to buy a piece of land where he can build a house and live with his children.  The loan he’s requesting will be used to buy a welding machine for his business.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Vernalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Vernalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Vernalyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her business.

Vernalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sack of rice to sell

loans.name: Zephanus

texts.en: Zephanus is a 38-year-old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the entertainment industry for five years. His business hardships are insufficient power supply and a permanent business location. His personal goals are to educate his children, build a permanent home and educate himself while his business goals are to build a permanent entertainment hall and to buy land to grow crops. Zephanus is requesting a loan to construct a better entertainment hall.

loans.use: to construct a better entertainment hall.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a 46-year-old widow with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been running a retail shop for 10 years and is also a farmer. She started with 1 million UGX and now has 4 million UGX as working capital. Sylvia is requesting money to buy pesticides and to construct shades for trees.

Her challenges are seasonal weather changes and inadequate capital to purchase stock. Her personal goals are educating her children, buying a car and building a permanent home, while her business goals are buying land to grow crops, moving her business to a more permanent location and expanding her business into new markets.

loans.use: to buy pestcides and construct shades for the trees

loans.name: Manantial Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MANANTIAL” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lidia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: elaboración de cereales. Venta de papa, producción de mantas, venta de comida, tejido de mantas, ayudante de minibús, elaboración de pan.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lidia es una integrante, ella indica que desde hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa a invitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas, nos da a conocer que hace años su suegra le enseño a realizar estos tejidos, ya que tenía una máquina de tejer, desde ahí inicia su negocio.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para ampliar el negocio (compra de lanas) mismo que comprará de las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido, todos los días. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “Manantial” (Spring) communal bank will start its third cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board presided over by Lidia.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses among which we have growing cereals, clothing sales, blanket weaving, food sales, blanked making, minibus assistant and bread baking.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit micro businesswomen among which is Lidia.  She states that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago having been invited to join by one of the institution’s promoters who visited her at home to invite her.  She currently has a blanket weaving business and she relates that her mother-in-law taught her how to do the weaving since she had a loom and this is how her business got started.

The loan she’ll take out now is to expand the business.  She will buy wool in the street markets in the city of El Alto and once production is done she’ll sell it based on orders every day.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family any way possible because she has a spouse and a son.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health services.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a thirty-seven-year-old married man with six children living in Kasese, Uganda.He has been selling clothes for six years and he got the initial capital after selling coffee. His major challenges are  inadequate capital to purchase clothing to meet the different tastes of his customers, high transportation costs and inflation. Personal goals are educating his children and building a permanent home while his business goals are buying land to grow crops and owning a modern boutique. Emmanuel wants money to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es: Guillermina pertenece al Banco Comunal Kausachun, tiene 52 años de edad, es casada y madre de 7 hijos varones. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 4 años. Ella se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos. En este tiempo como socia de FINCA Perú, Guillermina ha aprendido la importancia de ahorrar su dinero por más poquito que sea. Su sueño para el futuro es  poder comprar una casa linda que pueda compartir con su familia. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en su negocio, para la compra de los materiales e insumos que necesita para para la fabricación de ladrillos para vender.
texts.en: Guillermina belongs to the “Kausachun” communal bank.  She’s 52-years-old, married and mother of seven boys.  She’s been a member of FINCA Perú for four years.  She works manufacturing bricks.  In her time as a member of FINCA Perú, Guillermina has learned the importance of saving her money no matter how little it may be.  Her dream for the future is to be able to buy a pretty house she can share with her family.  The loan she’s requesting will be invested in her business; she will buy materials and supplies needed to manufacture bricks to sell.

loans.use: to buy brick-making supplies.

loans.name: Salvadora Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Salvadora es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien tiene una comideria desde hace 12 años. El negocio lo inicio vendiendo leche, pan, café y repostería poco a poco fue aumentándolo y su meta es seguir agrandándolo. 
Ella tiene tres hijos de los cuales solo el menor de 15 años depende de ella y es quien le ayuda en su negocio. El crédito anterior invirtió en la infraestructura del negocio ampliándolo físicamente.
texts.en: Salvadora is a hardworking, enterprising woman who has had an eatery for 12 years.  She started the business selling milk, bread, coffee and pastries and gradually added to it; her goal is to continue expanding it.  She has three children but only the youngest, 15-year-old still depends on her and helps her with her business.  She invested her previous loan in her business’ infrastructure expanding it physically.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Enhtaivan

texts.en: Enhtaivan is 36 years old and lives with her husband, Hatanbaatar, and 4 children in a ger in Bulgan province, Mongolia. Her two daughters go to secondary school and her 5-year-old daughter and 2-year-old son stay at home. Her husband is a seasonal machinist in Bulgan Meej LLC. She started her organic dairy production business in 2007 and sells organic milk and yogurt to local residents. She used to sell organic horse milk in the summer. She is a hardworking woman who says, "I would work more confidently for my children's future if I could purchase the needed equipment to expand my business".  She is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase equipment and machinery. With the equipment, she wants to produce organic curds and organic dried milk products as well as butter cream thereby increasing her household income.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and machinery to produce organic curds and dried milk products as well as butter cream.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El Sr. Jose Luis de 33 años, casado y con 3 hijos, cuenta con una antigüedad de más de 1 año desempeñándose como ayudante de recolector, se ha preocupado por su familia, que ya cuenta con casa propia y piensa ampliarla, para que el día de mañana su esposa tenga un buen patrimonio y que ofrecerle a sus hijos, solicita un crédito para iniciar barda por la seguridad de los niños.
texts.en:
José Luis, 33, is married with three children.  He has worked as the assistant to a collector for more than a year.

He's concerned about his family.  They already have their own house, which he plans to expand so in the future his wife has a good inheritance and so he can give it to his children.

He's requesting a loan to start building a wall for his children's security.

loans.use: to build a wall

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: La Sra. Carolina de 43 años de edad es casada y tiene 4 hijos aun que solo 3 dependen de ella económicamente. Ella trabaja en una maquiladora de la localidad además es dueña de un vehículo el cual utiliza como taxi el cual es su fuente de ingresos y lo maneja su esposo. En esta ocasión Carolina pide de nuestra ayuda para dar mantenimiento a su vehículo. Agradecerá la ayuda que se brinde.
texts.en:
Carolina, 43, is married and has four children, although only three of them are financially dependent on her.  She works in a "maquiladora" [foreign-owned factory] in the town.  She's also the owner of a vehicle that she uses as a taxi.  It's her source of income and her husband drives it.

Carolina is requesting our help to provide maintenance on her car.  She will be grateful for the help that is offered.

loans.use: to maintain her taxi

loans.name: Emiliana Hortencia

texts.es: Emiliana vive en la Isla Trinitaria sector sur urbano el cual está en constante regeneración. Es en este sector donde tiene un bazar y ventas de confetis en su domicilio, inicio su negocio ya que en su sector no había por lo que vio la oportunidad de que su negocio respondiera. El trabajo lo maneja sola todos los días la mayor parte del tiempo ya que no necesita cerrar. En su bazar la época estudiantil es en la que más vende ya que sus productos son cuadernos, cartulinas, plumas, gelatinas, colas etc. todos sus productos le dejan un margen de utilidad del 20%. Una de sus mayores preocupaciones son las enfermedades ya que al ser soltera e independiente no habría quien le ayude con la atención. Espera conseguir el crédito ya que con el aumentaría las mercaderías que tiene para aumentar su venta, su sueño es poder tener un negocio más grande para poder mejorar su casa.
texts.en: Emiliana lives in Isla Trinitaria, an urban sector that’s under constant renewal.  In this sector she has a general store and also sells snacks at home.  She started the business because there wasn’t any in her sector and she saw the opportunity for her business to succeed.  She runs the business by herself every day most of the time since she doesn’t need to close.  During the school year what she sells the most is notebooks, construction paper, pens, gelatin treats, soft-drinks, etc.  Her products produce a profit margin of 20%.  One of her greatest concern is illness because being single and independent she has no one to help her tend to the store.  She hopes to get the loan in order to increase the merchandise she has for sale.  Her dream is to have a larger business in order to be able to do some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, construction paper, pens, gelatin and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Casimiro

texts.en:
Casimiro and his family lives at Nabbotuan. He has five children but they live separately from them. To generate an income, he has managed a farming business for almost 20 years. He plants and harvests rice to sell. He also hires laborers who helped him do farming activities. 

Casimiro has decided to avail a loan in order to improve his crop production. He is borrowing PHP25,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides used in farming. He will also pay for labor costs.

Casimiro aspires for a productive harvest and to gain more profits from the business. Additional revenue will be saved for the nfamily's future expenses.

loans.use: to pay for labor cost, buy fertilizers and pesticides used in farming.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
Gulnora is 37 years old, and she is a hardworking woman with a great desire to progress in life. Her lifetime partner is a master of building houses, and they have 4 children. They live in the house her husband has succeeded in building thanks to his great dedication.

She is one of the successful business women of her town. For more than 12 years she has been busy selling toys in the local market. She knows all aspects of her business very well. Her experience and skill help her to develop her business and thus improve her living conditions. Nobody helps her with her business. She wants to develop the business further, but her income is small and she needs your help and mercy.

This loan will help her to buy goods for the new season and have more success in the business. She will be happy if you help her with money. She is also grateful for the support she received from the members of Imon International, as she trusts them and feels at ease with them. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of toys for the new season

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
This is Mariam, She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help towards the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 13,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and to pay for the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.
 
Mariam dreams to grow her business in the future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Marie Odette

texts.en:
Marie Odette is married and has four children, aged between 10 and 22 years. She has been rice a farmer for 34 years. She has requested a Kiva loan to use in seedling beds and to support labor costs. She plans to use the profits for paying school fees for her children and to pay for medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to use in bed seedling and to support labor costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and to pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 30 years old, from Nakuru, and has a child who is three years old and in school.

Julius has a quarrying business that he has been doing for the past eight years. He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy building materials for rental houses.

He hopes to own a quarry for stone extraction and to build more rental houses.

loans.use: to buy building materials for rental houses.

loans.name: Brigitte

texts.en:
Brigitte is married and has 2 children. They all still young. She has been a rice farmer for 15 years. She has requested a Kiva loan to use in seedling beds and to support labor costs. She plans to use the profits for paying school fees for the children and to pay for medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition, because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to use in bed seedlings and to support labor costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
