She learned about Milango through a friend with an aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. The challenge she is facing is high transport costs and seasonal weather.
Baby is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to buy charcoal wholesale and coconuts for selling. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to save for her own use. Her plan for the future is to build a business house and sell charcoal wholesale.

loans.use: to buy charcoal wholesale and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey lives in the Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has one child who attends school. He owns a transport business which he has been operating for three years. He also owns a motorbike from which he earns income.
He learned about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group and he joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. The challenge he is facing is insecurity.
Godfrey is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to repair his three-wheel vehicle and motorcycle. The extra income from this loan will be added to his savings to pay school fees for his child and improve the living standard of his family. His plan for the future is to expand the business to greater heights.

loans.use: to repair his three-wheel vehicle and motorcycle.

loans.name: Gricelda

texts.es:
Griselda, solicita un nuevo préstamo para poder invertir en mercadería para el negocio, manifiesta que a través de estos préstamos ella ha logrado mantener un nivel de inventarios adecuado para atender la demanda, por eso está motivada a continuar trabajando e invertir en productos como el maiz, leña, gas y azúcar, boquitas, jabón y detergentes, que son lo más necesario para poder mantener en el negocio en la tienda y la venta de tortillas.

Con el préstamo anterior logró realizar una buena inversión al negocio, aumentando la capacidad competitiva en el mercado, ella ha aumentado su clientela y ha mejorado sus ingresos cumpliendo con sus expectativas.
texts.en:
Griselda requests a new loan to buy merchandise for her business. As a result of these loans, she has been able to maintain an adequate level of inventory to meet demand.  She is motivated to continue working and investing in products such as corn, wood, gas, sugar, snacks, soap and detergents, which are the necessary products to keep her tortilla store in business.  

With the previous loan, she was able to make a good investment in the business, increasing her competitiveness in the market. She has increased her customer base and improved her income meeting by meeting her customer’s expectations.

loans.use: to buy corn, wood, gas, sugar, snacks, soap and detergents.

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El  socio es el  Sr. Claudio; el socio continua dedicandose al negocio de compra y venta de repuestos para autos, a la vez el socio se esta dedicando al negocio de brindar servicio tecnico ,el arregla conjuntamente con su esposa televisores,radios entre otros,el socio tiene su local por el centro de la ciudad lugar donde brinda sus servicios profesionales,el socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando para de esta manera seguir apoyando economicamente a su familia.
El socio solicita el credito para la compra de herramientas como desarmadores y alicates.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank "Unidos Para el Triunfo" (United for Triumph). This bank is located in the Huanchac district in the province of Cusco, in the department of Cusco.

The member is Mr. Claudio. He still works buying and selling auto parts, and at the same time does technical support. He, along with his wife, fixes televisions and radios, among other things. He works in the center of the city, where he brings his professional services. He is a responsible and hard-working individual who wishes to continue working in order to continue supporting his family economically. He is asking for the loan to purchase tools such 
as screwdrivers and pliers.

He is thankful for and values the loan he was given through Kiva, and in this same way he promises to pay the payments on-time.

loans.use: To buy tools like screwdrivers and pliers.

loans.name: Alex

texts.es:
Alex es un hombre muy responsable y sobre todo muy trabajador. Vive en la casa que su suegro le heredó, junto a su esposa Haydee y sus dos hijas gemelas de 7 años.
Hace 18 años que se dedica a los campos de cultivo, ahora tiene tres hectáreas con plantas de café, por las que toma mucho empeño por obtener una buena producción. Las veces en que realiza el mantenimiento o las cosechas cuenta con el apoyo de jornaleros, quienes lo apoyan para que los cerezos de café sean de buena calidad. Para él, su trabajo es lo más importante, ya que es lo que mejor sabe hacer y también le genera buenos ingresos en cada temporada.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y agradece la oportunidad que le brindan para que siga con sus planes de trabajo. Asimismo, se compromete a ser responsable con sus cuotas de pago.
Con los 3,000 nuevos soles solicitados contratará peones para que le ayuden a desyerbar sus cultivos, con el resto de dinero comprará abono para esparcir en sus plantas.
texts.en:
Alex is a very responsible man, and above all, a hard-worker. He lives in a house left to him by his father-in-law, along with his wife Haydee and their 7-year-old twin daughters.

He has been working in the country as a farmer for 18 years, and now has three hectares with coffee plants, which take a lot of effort in order to see a good crop. The times in which he has succeeded in maintaining or harvesting the plants have been with the help of day laborers, who help to make sure that the coffee beans are high-quality. For him, his work is the most important thing, since it is what he knows how to do best and also earns him a good income every season.

This is his first loan with MFP and he is thankful for the opportunity that it brings him to continue with his work plans. Therefore, he promises to be responsible with the payments.

With the 3,000 new soles (Peruvian currency) he is asking for, he will hire laborers who will help him weed his plants, and with the rest of the money he will purchase fertilizer to spread on his plants.

loans.use: To hire works to help weed his plants, and to buy fertilizer to spread on his crops.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 25 años, su pareja es Candel, de 29 años, con quien tiene un hijo de 6 años. 
Junto a su cónyuge ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas; cultiva plantas de café, el cual vende en su misma localidad al por mayor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde su chacra hasta la zona de venta, ya que los sacos son muy pesados. Para más adelante, desea otro terreno donde pueda seguir cultivando café, por ahora su prioridad es comprar fertilizantes y abono para hacer el mantenimiento de sus cultivos.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y está muy alegre por el apoyo que le brindan, ya que así puede cumplir con su trabajo. Cuenta que el grupo de su banco comunal es muy alegre y comparten experiencias de trabajo entre todos.
Con los 500 nuevos soles que ahora solicita comprará abono para sus plantas.
texts.en:
Carmen is 25 years old, her partner is Candel, 29 years old, with whom she has a 6 year-old boy.

Along with her spouse, she has worked the land and has returned them to productivity. She grows coffee plants, which she sells wholesale in her area. What she likes most about her work is to tend to the plants and take great care of them. She has been working at this for 6 years and what she considers to be the most difficult is the transportation of her products from her farmhouse to the market, since the bags are very heavy. To better succeed, she wants another plot where she can continue growing coffee. For now, her priority is buying fertilizers in order to maintain her plants.

This is her third loan with MFP and she is very happy for the support that it brings, since this way she can successfully do her job. She says that the group of her community bank is very happy and shares work experiences among themselves.

With the 500 new soles (Peruvian currency) that she is asking for, she will purchase fertilizer for her plants.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her plants.

loans.name: Ashura

texts.en:
Ashura lives in the Likoni area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is single. She owns a retail shop, which she has been operating for six years. She started the business with her brother’s savings and through a "Merry go round" - an informal system whereby each participant contributes a certain amount of money and lends to one person at a time.

Ashura learned about Milango through a friend and joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. The challenges she faces are high transport costs and seasonal weather.

Ashura is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar and maize flour at wholesale prices, as well as cereals. The extra income she earns as a result of the loan will be added to her savings, used to lift her living standards, and for personal use. Her plan for the future is to build a business building and sell at wholesale prices.

loans.use: To buy sugar and maize flour at wholesale prices, as well as cereals.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Domitila tiene 30 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora.Vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja, Justiniano de 39 años, y sus tres hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.
Ella se dedica al cultivo de cacao y plátano. Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, trabaja en sus tierras porque sabe que el dinero que obtenga de la venta de su cosecha dependerá mucho de la calidad de sus productos. Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta de su actividad es el proceso de cosecha, ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido sus frutos. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras. Para más adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras y seguir cultivando plantas de cacao; por lo que ahora prioriza en contratar a jornaleros para que quiten la hierba y abonen sus tierras.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado agradece a su banco comunal por darle la oportunidad de trabajar con ellos.
Con los 1000 nuevos soles de este préstamo contratará a jornaleros para que le ayuden en el abonado.
texts.en:
Domitila, 30, is a modest, hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her partner, 39-year-old Justiniano, and their three children, whom she wishs to give a better life. She plants cacao and plantains. Very early each morning, she works her land because she knows that the money from her harvest depends greatly on the quality of her produce. This is also what she treasures about her work, that is, she feels that the months of labor have born fruit. She has been farming for 10 years and believes that fumigating the land is the most difficult part. In the future, she wants to buy additional  plots to grow more cacao. Her current priority is hiring day laborers to pull weeds and fertilize her land.

This is her second loan cycle with MFP, and she is pleased to know that she has financial support that will ensure that she can continue with her business. She is also grateful to her communal bank for giving her the opportunity to work with them. She will use the loan of 1000 nuevos soles to hire day laborers to help her fertilize the land.

loans.use: to hire day laborers to fertilize her fields.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 26 years old. She is the mother of one child and she is married to a driver. She sells different items in her store. With this loan, she wants to add more rice, sugar, and a refrigerator to use in her business. She will use the profits from her business to boost her savings.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar, and a refrigerator to use in her business.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine sells beers that are commonly known as Primus. She has been in this business for three years. She wants to increase and upgrade her pub by adding more beers to sell. She believes that this business has helped her as well as her family. With the profits from the business, she will use them to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy more beers to sell

loans.name: Fortunato

texts.es:
Fortunato tiene 46 años, junto a su esposa, Clara, tiene cuatro hijos, y juntos viven en la casa que compraron durante los años de convivencia que llevan.
Hace 20 años que se dedica al cultivo de cacao, labor que realiza con el apoyo de jornaleros. Menciona que desde niño aprendió a labrar la tierra gracias a la enseñanza de sus padres y hoy trabaja en sus propios terrenos. Las cosechas que obtiene Fortunato las lleva a vender a los centros de acopio, quienes le gratifican a muy buenos precios, ya que son de muy buena calidad. Sin embargo su mayor dificultad es movilizar los sacos hasta la ciudad donde las vende, por ello su deseo es comprar una moto carguero que le servirá para movilizar sus productos y ganará algo más transportando los de sus vecinos.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y agradece por la confianza que una vez más le brindan, ya que le dan la oportunidad de seguir mejorando su calidad de vida.
Con este préstamo realizará la compra de una moto carguero que le servirá para mejorar su trabajo y tener un ingreso adicional.
texts.en:
Fortunato, 46, and his wife Clara have four children. They live in the house they bought during the years they lived together. For 20 years, he has grown cacao with the help of day laborers. He says that as a child his parents taught him how to farm, and now he works his own land. Fortunato takes his harvest to sell to warehouses, where he receives good prices because his products are high quality. However, his greatest problem is moving the sacks to the city to sell them. He would like to buy a cargo motorbike to transport his products and to earn extra money transporting his neighbors' products. 

This is his second loan cycle with MFP. He is grateful for the confidence the institution has in him once again by offering him the opportunity to continue improving his circumstances. He will use this loan to buy a cargo motorbike to upgrade his business and add income.

loans.use: to buy a cargo motorbike to transport his harvest.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene lives in the Likoni area of Coast Province. She is single. She operates a hawking business, which she has been operating for two years now. She started the business through her own little savings. In this business she sells clothes, sanitary pads, and cosmetics.

Irene learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operation of her business. The challenges she faces are high transport costs, as she walks or hires a mode of transport; purchasing stock; and finding customers.

Irene is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenyan shillings to buy a motorbike for transportation to reach her customers. She believes that in this way, she can make some profits. Her extra income as a result of the loan will be put towards her savings, expanding her business, and personal use. Her future plan is to buy a public service vehicle.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Venancie

texts.en: Venancie is 32 years old. She is married and has two children. She sells shoes and has been selling shoes for the past 15 years. With this loan, she wants to buy more shoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to save as much as possible and to upgrade her business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Tsuma

texts.en:
Tsuma lives in the Likoni area of Coast Province. He is married and has six children. He owns a food stall, which he has been operating for four years now. He started the business through his own little savings.

Tsuma learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operation of his business. The challenges he faces are high transport and fuel costs and seasonal weather.

Tsuma is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings to purchase cassava, potatoes, etc. His will use the extra income as a result of the loan to increase his savings. His future plans are to expand his business, sell at wholesale prices, and become a supplier in the area.

loans.use: To purchase cassava, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en: Eugenie is 30 years old. She is a mother of two children, ages two and five years old. She sells shoes and has been in the business for ten years. She wants a loan to buy more shoes to sell. The profits from her business will be used to provide food for her family.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has one child. He owns a transport business that he has been operating for six months. He started this business from his parents' savings. He aspires to start a poultry farm.

Emmanuel learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are price fluctuations and inflation, the high prices of fuel and transport, and finding customers.

Emmanuel is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenyan shillings to venture into poultry farming, e.g. to purchase chicks and feed. The extra income he earns as a result of the loan will be added to his savings and used to expand the poultry business. His future plans are to buy vehicles for transport.

loans.use: To venture into poultry farming, e.g. to purchase chicks and feed.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne sells shoes, and has been in this business for four years. She is 27 years old and single, but she takes care of one child who is five years old. She wants this loan to buy more shoes to sell. The profits from her business will be used to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Jose Fernando Miguel

texts.es: El sr Fernando es separado y vive con su hijo quien lo apoya por que ya esta trabajando.  El sr Fernando se siente tranquilo por que el ya tiene un patrimonio y un trabajo estable. Solo desea estar bien de salud para así seguir luchando para un patrimonio mejor. El sr Fernando tiene unas complicaciones de salud no graves pero la cuales debe atenderse, necesita una operación no es muy costosa pero su hijo se preocupa porque en ocasiones se pone un poco mal su papá. El préstamo le ayudara a pagar parte de la operación y así poder sentirse mejor, y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Fernando is separated and lives with his son, who helps with the household expenses since he is already working.  He feels content because he has a stable job and sufficient assets to pass on to his son. All he wants is to be in good health so he can continue working and fighting to build up a better inheritance for his son.

Fernando has some health problems, which are not serious, but he needs to attend to them.  He needs an operation, which is not expensive.  His son worries about him sometimes when he is not feeling well.  The loan will cover a portion of the cost of the operation and allow him to feel better and keep working.

loans.use: to pay for an operation.

loans.name: Yalatu Group

texts.es: Doña Glenys es miembro del Grupo Solidario Yalatu, tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos. Glenys inicio hace 2 años cuando un amigo llegaba a su casa y le vendían comida y fue desde ese entonces que decidio comenzar el negocio, se llama golosinas Danny, ella está solicitando este préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de productos de la canasta básica para hacer bocadillos. Ella comienza a trabajar desde las 6:00 A.M y culmina a las 8:00 P.M, espera que con la ayuda del préstamo pueda surtir su negocio y así poderles ofrecer a sus clientes todo lo que necesiten. Sus metas es tener mejores ingresos para poder ayudar a sus hijos a cubrir los gastos estudiantiles. Glenys es el primer financiamiento que recibe de FAMA y espera cancelar sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Glenys is a member of the group Solidario Yalatu.  She is 34 years old and is a single mother of two children.  She decided to start her business, which is named "Golosinas Danny" two years ago when a friend of hers came to her home selling food.

She is seeking this loan so that she can buy canned products that she will use to make snacks.  She starts working at 6:00 am and finishes at 8:00 pm.  She hopes that with the help of the loan she will be able to stock her business and offer her customers everything that they need.  Her goal is to increase her income so that she can help her children cover their educational expenses.  

This is her first loan from FAMA, and she hopes to repay her loan on schedule.

loans.use: to buy canned goods.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nélida tiene 31 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora. Vive en la casa que compró junto a su esposo Víctor, de 39 años, con ellos habitan sus tres hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.
Tiene una tienda en su vivienda, la cual atiende con la ayuda de su hijo mayor, mientras que su esposo trabaja en sus campos de cultivo. Ella empezó a trabajando también en la chacra, pero luego con las ganancias logró abrir tener el negocio que tanto anhelaba. Ahora, muy contenta, comenta que sus clientes quedan contentos al saber que pueden obtener los abarrotes que necesitan de su tienda. Hace 7 años que realiza su labor y lo que más le gusta es conversar y atender a sus clientes; el problema es cuando se va agotando su mercadería y ya no puede ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y está muy contenta de saber que contará con este apoyo para seguir creciendo con su negocio. 
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles que ahora solicita comprará conservas, verduras, cereales, azúcar y otros, para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Nélida is 31 years old and a very hardworking woman. She and her husband, Victor, 39, live in a home they bought together, along with their three children, who are the reason for all of their hard work. 

She has a store in her residence that she manages with the help of her oldest son, while her husband works in their fields. She also began working on the land, however later, with their earnings, she succeeded in opening the business she had yearned to have for so long. Now, very happy, she notes that her customers are pleased to know that they can obtain the groceries they need in her store. She has been doing this work for 7 years and what she most enjoys is talking to and helping her customers; the problem occurs when her merchandise becomes depleted and she can no longer provide good service to her clients.

This is her first loan from MFP and she is very pleased to know that she will be able to rely on this support to continue expanding her business. With the S/. 1,000 she is requesting she will purchase canned food, vegetables, cereals, sugar and other items to stock her store.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, vegetables, cereals, sugar and other items to stock her store.

loans.name: Kaingu

texts.en: Kaingu lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya with his wife and three children. For the last four years, he has made a living by running a retail shop which he started with personal savings. He supplements his income by running a transportation business. His friends introduced him to Milango Financial Services as a way to secure credit and improve his business. His main challenges are price fluctuations, inflation and high prices for fuel and transportation. Kaingu is applying for a loan for 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy more items such as bread and flour to sell to his customers. The extra income he earns as a result of this loan will allow him to add to his savings and expand his business. His goal for the future is to expand the business by opening another retail shop.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
Marleni tiene 28 años, vive en su la casa que sus padres le dieron por herencia. Tiene dos hijos;  Roy de 10 años y Britza de 3 añitos, ellos son su motivo de seguir adelante para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. 
Ella ha logrado obtener sus propias tierras para cultivar cacao y hoja de coca, estas plantas son las que mantienen su economía. En tiempos de cosecha contrata a jornaleros para extraer con mayor rapidez los frutos, pues sola no podría terminar a tiempo. La venta de sus cosechas en la ciudad que está a 6 horas de su comunidad; esta labor la realiza hace 10 años y ya tiene mucho conocimiento de todo lo que necesitan este tipo de plantas para su mejor crecimiento.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, ella ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras. 
Esta vez, con los 2,000 nuevos soles comprará abono orgánico y también contratará a peones para que le ayuden con el abonado.
texts.en:
Marleni is 28 years old and lives in the house she inherited from her parents. She has two children: Roy, who is ten, and little Britza, who is three. They are her reason for moving forward in order to offer them a better quality of life.

She has managed to obtain her own land in order to grow cacao and coca leaves, which are the plants that support her business. During the harvest season, she hires laborers in order to pick the fruit more quickly, because she would not be able to finish in time by herself. She sells the harvest in the city, which is six hours away from her community. She has been in this business for ten years and has acquired much knowledge about what these types of plants need in order to grow best.

This is her third loan with MFP. She has paid off her previous loans on time and expects to do the same now. As a member of her communal bank, she is very well-loved by her fellow members.
 
This time around, she will use the 2,000 nuevos soles to purchase organic fertilizer and also to hire laborers to help her fertilize.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and hire laborers to work her land.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma es una mujer muy activa, tiene 30 años y junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos viven en la casa que compraron gracias al esfuerzo de sus trabajos.
Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas en los paraderos de transporte de su comunidad. Esta labor la realiza hace 8 años y comenta que siempre tiene bueno ingresos, ya que los carros que transitan por su localidad son muy frecuentes. El problema que tiene es cuando la fruta que cosecha de su parcela se le acaba, por ello tiene que comprar frutas de otras personas para seguir con su trabajo. 

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se siente contenta por la oportunidad de este préstamo, ya que así seguirá con su negocio. Asimismo, se siente agradecida con las socias de su banco comunal por permitirle ser parte.
Con este dinero comprará frutas cítricas (naranjas, mandarinas) de otra parcela para vender en su puesto.
texts.en:
Norma is a very active 30 year old woman.  She lives with her husband and their three children in the house that they bought thanks to the effort of their work.

She sells fruit at the transportation stops in her community.  She has been doing this for eight years.  She says that she always has good income because cars travel very frequently through her area.  The problem that she has is that when she runs out of fruit harvested from her land she has to buy fruit from other people in order to continue with her work.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She is happy about the opportunity of this loan because this way she will continue with her business.  She is grateful to the members of her communal bank for allowing her to be a part of it.

She will use the loan to buy citrus fruits (oranges, tangerines) from another plot of land in order to sell them at her stand.

loans.use: to buy citrus fruits (oranges, tangerines) from another plot of land in order to sell them at her stand.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna tiene 20 años, es una joven muy amable, vive en la casa que sus suegros le dieron por herencia a su pareja, Edilio de 20 años, tienen una hija, quien es el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.
Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, Reyna abre su tienda de abarrotes para atender a sus vecinos, es una vendedora muy hábil, sabe como tratar a sus clientes y siempre  termina obsequiándole un dulce o cualquier otro producto. Su tienda está muy bien surtida, ya que siempre se preocupa por comprar los productos que le hacen falta. Lleva un año realizando esta actividad y cuenta que es lo que más le gusta porque de esa manera puede estar siempre al cuidado de su pequeña hija sin hacer mayor esfuerzo. Para más adelante, espera ampliar los productos de su tienda para tener más que ofrecer.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y agradece la oportunidad que, una vez más, le brindan para continuar con sus planes de mejorar su negocio.  Y también agradece a las personas de su banco comunal por la apertura que le dieron.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles de este préstamo se abastecerá de mercadería comprando arroz, azúcar, menestras, gaseosas, especias, etc.
texts.en:
Reyna, 20, is a very pleasant young woman.  She lives in the house her in-laws passed town to her spouse, Edilio, 20.  They have a daughter who is the main reason for all their efforts.  

Reyna opens her grocery store very early in the morning every day to tend to her neighbors.  She’s a very skilled seller; she knows how to treat her customers and always ends up offering them a candy or some other product.  Her store is very well stocked because she always takes care of buying whatever products she needs.  She’s been in this activity for a year and she relates that it’s what she likes best because she can care for her little girl without much effort.  For later on, she hopes to expand the products in her store to have more to offer.

This is her second MFP loan and she is grateful for the opportunity she’s getting once more to be able to continue with her plans for improving her business.  She also thanks the people in her communal bank for the opening they gave her.

She will use the 1000 new soles from this loan to stock her store with merchandise; she will buy rice, sugar, vegetables, soft-drinks, spices, etc.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Mónica tiene 20 años, es una mujer amable. Vive en una casa alquilada desde hace 6 meses, junto a su esposo Franklin y su hijo Jean Pierre.  
Aún no cuenta con terrenos propios, pero la agricultura es su principal actividad económica, la cual le proporciona la solvencia económica que necesita. Hace poco abrió una tienda de comestibles en su vivienda para poder ahorrar y así comprar sus propios terrenos agrícolas. Sus principales sembríos son papa, maíz y frejol; ahora mismo tiene sembríos de maíz. En cada cosecha comercializa sus alimentos a la ciudad e en su mismo terreno; “todo depende, si encuentro comprador antes de que maduren los productos, llegan en la cosecha, al mismo terreno”, comenta.  Ahora quiere incursionar en la compra y venta de animales, pues ve ahí una buena opción de generar más ingresos. 

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Puntaman puririsum Sachamarca”, que en español significa “Adelante caminemos Sachamarca”. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y le gusta mucho el trabajo que realiza en su grupo, pues en cada reunión aprende nuevas ideas para sus sembríos, ya que todos se ayudan y cooperan, por ello promete ser puntual en pago de sus cuotas.
Mónica invertirá este dinero en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para su próxima siembra de papa de la variedad “amarilla”.
texts.en:
Mónica, 20, is a kind woman living in a house she rented six months ago with her husband, Franklin, and their son, Jean Pierre.  She still does not own fields of her own but agriculture is her main economic activity and it produces the economic solvency she needs.  

She opened a home-based grocery store recently to be able to save and buy her own farmland.  Her main crops are potatoes, corn and broad beans.  She currently is growing corn.  She sells each harvest in the city and direct from her field.  “Everything depends on whether or not I find a buyer before the products ripen.  They come to the very field for the harvest,” she comments.  She now wants to go into the buying and selling of animals because she sees it as a good option for generating more income.

She belongs to the “Puntaman Puririsum Sachamarca” communal bank which in Spanish means “Adelante Caminemos Sachamarca” [Sachamarca, Let’s Walk Forward).  This is her second MFP loan and she very much enjoys the work the group does because she learns new ideas for her crops at each meeting since everyone helps everyone else and cooperates with each other.  Because of this, she promises to be punctual with her installment payments.  Mónica will use this money to buy natural fertilizer for her next crop of potatoes of the “amarilla” variety.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 31 años, es una mujer muy atenta y amable. Vive en la casa que heredó de su madre, desde hace 4 años, junto a su esposo Nelson y sus dos hijos: Emerson y Sheyla.  
Su actividad económica, junto a su esposo, es la agricultura. “Cuando es época de siembra y cosecha se trabaja muy duro”, afirma. Ya tienen 5 años de experiencia en la agricultura, comenzaron cuando formaron su familia, pues sus padres le heredaron terrenos productivos en los que comenzaron a sembrar. Sus principales productos son papa, maíz y alverja, y los venden en la ciudad, donde ya tiene compradores fijos. 

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Puntaman puririsum Sachamarca”, que en español significa “Adelante caminemos Sachamarca”. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y le gusta mucho el trabajo que realiza en su grupo, pues en cada reunión aprende nuevas ideas para sus sembríos, ya que todos se ayudan y cooperan, por ello promete ser puntual en pago de sus cuotas.
María invertirá este dinero en la compra de semilla de papa de la variedad “peruanita” y fertilizantes naturales para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
María, 31, is an attentive, kind woman living in the house she inherited from her mother four years ago with her husband, Nelson, and their two children, Emerson and Sheyla.  Her and her husband’s economic activity is agriculture.  “During planting and harvesting seasons one works very hard,” she affirms.  They have five years’ experience in agriculture; they started when they formed their family because their parents passed down productive land to them that they started to plant in.  Her main products are potatoes, corn and peas that they sell in the city where she already has regular buyers.

She belongs to the “Puntaman Puririsum Sachamarca” communal bank which in Spanish means “Adelante Caminemos Sachamarca” [Sachamarca, Let’s Walk Forward].  This is her fourth loan with MFP and she likes the group’s work very much because she learns new things for her crops at every meeting because they all help each other out and cooperate which is why she promises to be punctual with her installment payments.  María will use this money to buy potato seeds of the “peruanita” variety as well as natural fertilizer for her crops.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
Zenaida tiene 43 años, vive en la casa que compró hace 25 años, junto a su esposo, Domingo, y sus tres hijos.  
Ellos se dedican a varias actividades; Zenaida cuida de sus animales, tiene cerdos y ovejas que vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad; por su lado Domingo, se dedica a la venta de leña, él mismo compra los árboles que cortará para comercializarlos. Más la actividad económica que los une es la agricultura, ya tienen 20 años sembrando, papa, maíz y habas en los terrenos propios que durante tanto tiempo lograron adquirir gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación. Ahora se preparan para la siembra grande, pues los productos que obtengan madurarán en el mes de enero del año que entra, mes donde se incrementa el precio, en especial de la papa.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Puntaman puririsum  Sachamarca”, que en español significa “Adelante caminemos Sachamarca”. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP y le gusta mucho el trabajo que realiza en su grupo, pues en cada reunión aprende nuevas ideas para sus sembríos, ya que todos se ayudan y cooperan, por ello promete ser puntual en pago de sus cuotas.
Zenaida invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de 100 sacos de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir en su próximo sembrío de papa.
texts.en:
Zenaida, 43, lives in the house she bought 25 years ago with her husband, Domingo, and their three children.  They carry out a variety of activities.  Zenaida cares for her animals; she has pigs and sheep that she sells whenever she needs to.  On his side, Domingo sells firewood.  He buys the trees himself that he chops into wood to sell.  In addition, the economic activity they do together is agriculture since they’ve been growing potatoes, corn and lima beans for 20 years on land of their own that they were able to acquire over the years thanks to their dedication and effort.  They are now getting ready for the big planting because products obtained will ripen in January of next year, a month when the price of potatoes especially rises.

She belongs to the “Puntaman Puririsum Sachamarca” communal bank which in Spanish means “Adelante Caminemos Sachamarca” [Sachamarca, Let’s Walk Forward].  This is her seventh loan with MFP and she likes the group’s work very much because she learns new things for her crops at every meeting because they all help each other out and cooperate which is why she promises to be punctual with her installment payments.  Zenaida will use the money from this loan to buy 100 sacks of natural fertilizer to spread among her upcoming potato crop.

loans.use: to buy 100 sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma tiene 30 años, vive en la casa que compró desde hace 10 años, junto a su esposo Edwin y sus dos hijos Lissy y Leona. 
La crianza de animales y la siembra de productos agrícolas es su principal ingreso económico. Cuenta que su esposo se dedica a negociar el precio de los animales maduros, mientras que ella cuida de sus sembríos de maíz y papa. Ahora tiene sembrado maíz en terrenos propios y alquilados, pues no se abastece y tiene que alquilar más. Ya tiene 7 años de experiencia en la agricultura y en todo este tiempo logró obtener mucho conocimiento, “quiero tener alimentos de calidad, por lo que aprenderé mucho más para poder lograr mi objetivo”, comenta. Ahora se encuentra preparándose para la siembra grande de papa, pues desea obtener mejores ganancias en la temporada que llega.  

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Puntaman puririsum Sachamarca”, que en español significa “Adelante caminemos Sachamarca”. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP y le gusta mucho el trabajo que realiza en su grupo, pues en cada reunión aprende nuevas ideas para sus sembríos, ya que todos se ayudan y cooperan, por ello promete ser puntual en pago de sus cuotas.
Vilma invertirá este dinero en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para la siembra de papa.
texts.en:
Vilma, 30, lives in the house she bought ten years ago with her husband, Edwin, and their two children Lissy and Leona.  Her main economic activity is producing agricultural products and raising animals.  She relates that her husband takes care of negotiating the price for mature animals while she takes care of the corn and potato crops.  She currently is growing corn in her own fields and on leased land because her land isn’t sufficient and she has to lease more.  She has 7 years’ experience in agriculture and in all this time she’s acquired much knowledge.  “I want to produce good quality food so I will learn much to be able to reach my objective,“ she comments.  She’s now getting ready for the big potato planting because she wants to earn good profits in the upcoming season.

She belongs to the “Puntaman Puririsum Sachamarca” communal bank which in Spanish means “Adelante Caminemos Sachamarca” [Sachamarca, Let’s Walk Forward].  This is her eighth loan with MFP and she likes the group’s work very much because she learns new things for her crops at every meeting because they all help each other out and cooperate which is why she promises to be punctual with her installment payments.  Vilma will use this money to buy natural fertilizer for her potato crops.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizer for her potato crops.

loans.name: Gaspard

texts.en: Gaspard is 33 years old, married and the father of three children, all of whom attend school. He earns a living by selling shoes and has been in this line of work for three years. He is requesting a loan to buy more shoes to sell, and plans to use the profit he earns to buy a house for his family to live in because he is tired of renting.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Xiomara

texts.en:
Xiomara has been running a grocery store in the city of Hato Mayor, a rural area where agricultural activities are common, for around seven years. She is dedicated to selling groceries, candies, snacks, and meal ingredients (rice, beans, meat, canned food, and vegetables) as well as many other goods in her little Colmado (small grocery store in the neighborhood).

Having repaid her previous loans, Xiomaras is requesting a new one to expand her business inventory by purchasing more of the above-mentioned goods.

Residing with her long-term partner and her two children, Xiomara says that her most difficult challenge is to take care of her family. She thanks all of you for your support!!!

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, canned food, cooking oil and other goods.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is a resident of the Kilifi area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has four children who all attend school. She operates a clothes business, a business that she has been operating for ten years. She also earns salary from a poultry firm she operates.

She learned about Milango through a friend. She wants to access credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are seasonal weather and competition from other similar businesses. Julita is applying for a loan of 83,500 KES to buy clothes for her business. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to increase her income and improve the living standard of her life. She aspires to open a boutique and a cosmetics business.

loans.use: To buy clothes for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has four children. She owns a retail shop that sells brooms, a business that she has been operating for ten years. She started her business with her personal savings.

She learned about Milango through some friends who invited her to the group. She joined the group with the aim of accessing loans to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are customers not paying on time and purchasing inventory.

Farida is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya Shillings to pay for her transport expenses and buy more brooms. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to pay for her children's school fees. Her goal is to build a storefront.

loans.use: To pay for her transport expenses and buy more brooms

loans.name: Heshimu

texts.en:
Heshimu lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is single. He owns a barber shop, a business that he has been operating for seven years. He started his business with his personal savings.

He learned about Milango through some friends who invited him to the group. He joined the group with the aim of accessing loans to improve his business operations. His main challenges are price fluctuations, inflation, theft, and purchasing equipment.

Heshimu is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya Shillings to purchase barber shop equipment, etc. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to buy a shaver. His goal is to expand his business through opening another barber shop.

loans.use: To purchase barber shop equipment, etc.

loans.name: Tsuma

texts.en: Tsuma lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married, has two children and has earned a living for the last three years by running a retail shop where he sells spare parts for motorbikes. He started the business using his personal savings. Tsuma learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group so he could access credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are price fluctuations, inflation and the  high cost of fuel and transport. He is applying for a loan for 62,650 Kenyan shillings to buy spare parts that are not now available in his shop. His will use the extra income made possible by the loan to increase his savings. His plan for the future is to open more spare-parts shops in other areas.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Baptisseurs Plus Group

texts.en:
Kiese is the chairman of the Community Bank named “Baptisseurs Plus,” which is composed of six members united to receive Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Kiese became a micro-entrepreneur in 1999. He manages his own general store in the West of Kinshasa. He works hard with good management skills in order to realize his dream of someday owning a larger shop in Kinshasa. His business brings in US$80 per week. Kiese is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having received and repaid 10 loans. He will increase his stock of merchandise with his next loan by purchasing, soaps, canned goods, sacks of beans and sugar and milk and reselling them at a profit. Kiese is married and the father of four children, two who attend school. Their ages range from 16 and 23 years old.

loans.use: to increase the store’s stock by buying soap, canned goods, sugar, sacks of beans and toilet items to resell at profit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tire tubes, sprockets and brake pads.

loans.name: Edison

texts.en:
Edison lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has eight children. He owns rental houses, a business that he has been operating for 12 years. He started the business through his personal savings.
He learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are tenants not paying on time and price fluctuations and inflation.
Edison is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to complete the construction of his unfinished guest house. His future plan is to become a leading real estate businessman in his area.

loans.use: to complete the construction of his unfinished guest house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes and material for tailoring.

loans.name: Fema

texts.en: Fema, 57, is married and has four children. Fema resides in San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for seven years. Each month, she earns 4,800 PHP. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand product offerings. In 2008, Fema joined GDMPC. In the future, Fema wants to build a house and for her children to complete their studies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offerings.
